result.execSummary:
The defendant Karen K Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 16CM129, 15CM417, 15CM277, and 15CT527 called together at 10:19am [mo]
Defendant Karen K Mueller in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.   ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Beck verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 16CM129(Initial Appearance occurs)
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant
No demand for speedy trial

The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling of Case 16CM129 and 15CT527

As to Cases 15CM277 and 15CM417:
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " GUILTY " entered on Cases 15CM277 and 15CM417; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Cases 15CM277 and 15CM417, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, with conditions:

The Court orders all the conditions as outlined in the Criminal Case Settlement.

[which are:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/ or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription 
--take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--provide agent with a list of all current prescriptions and dosages from treating physician(s)
--no operation of any motor vehicle without express agent approval and valid drivers license
--no contact with any known drug offender, except for treatment purposes per Agent
--to submit DNA sample 
--to pay statutory costs]

The Court distributes its scheduling order for case 15CT527

Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 10:50am
NEXT: As to Case 16CM129: (1)DA PTC on 4/20/16 at 10:20am (2)STC on 6/13/16 at 2:00pm
            As to Case 15CT527: (1)FSSC on 6/13/16 at 2:00pm (2)Jury Trial on 6/16/16 at 8:30am (one day trial)

Cases 15CM277 and 15CM417 called together at 1:07pm [mo]
[Scheduled for Plea/Sent]
Defendant Karen K Mueller in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger and Attorney Wineke.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Wineke requests to allow Atty. Luchsinger to substitute as counsel for case 15CM417
--no objection from Ms. Mueller
--no objection from ADA Teuber

The Court grants the substitution Atty. Luchsinger is now attorney of record for both cases
Atty. Wineke exits the courtroom at 1:11pm

Atty. Luchsinger requests an adjournment of todays hearing
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.

Atty. Luchsinger requests that these cases be scheduled with case 15CT527
--the Court grants this request.
recess: 1:14pm

NEXT: As to Both Cases: Status Conference on 3/22/16 at 10:00am

Court's Response to Bookeeping Memorandum

Address at Next Hearing; 3/4/16 at 1pm
to Judge from Bkpg - Regarding: Failure to Comply with Court Order concerning payment of AFT payments.

MINUTES FROM CASE 15CM417
Case called at 10:53 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Karen K Mueller in court, in-custody, with Attorney Annamarie Amy Wineke. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim RIghts Compliance Cerified; Court so finds
Atty Wineke: Requests matter be set for plea/sentencing along with 15CM277 for joint plea/sentencing.
off-record for scheduling: 10:54 - 10:58 am
Clerk announces date for the record
Atty Luchsinger who is present in the gallery requests that the 2/16/16 STC in case 15CM277, be removed from calendar; Court grants
Recess: 10:59 am 

NEXT: BOTH CASES 15CM417 & 15CM277 (1) Schedule Plea/Sentencing 3/4/16 at 1:00 pm - Send notices

Cases 15CT527 and 15CM277 called together at 8:48am [mo]
Defendant Karen K Mueller in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Mueller. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.

As to Case 15CT527 (Initial Appearance occurs):
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

The Court requires $1000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--maintain absolute sobriety

As to Case 15CM277 (Status Conference occurs):

Atty. Luchsinger requests that both cases be scheduled for PTC 
--no objection from ADA Teuber; notes that PTC do not occur in CT cases

recess:8:55am 

[[Post-Hearing//Off-Record: The Clerk inquires of the Court the amount of the signature bond; the Court informs the Clerk $1000]]

NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/13/16 at 10:00am   (2)  Status Conference on 2/16/16 at 9:00am

Case called at 1:36pm [mo]
Defendant Karen K Mueller appears in court, in custody.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court reviews the Court Record. 
  
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court enters a "not guilty" plea on behalf of Ms. Mueller

The Court indicates that Atty. Luchsinger, counsel of record, can request a speedy trial within the next 10 days. 
The Court reinstates the signature bond as issued previously.
The Court reminds Ms. Mueller that she is to be at all court appearances and to contact her attorney. 
recess: 1:44pm


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on  10/14/15 at 8:20am  (2)  Status Conference on 12/4/15 at 8:30am
The Court appoints Attorney Luchsinger//repayment order of $30 a month starting 11-20-15
A new court date is to be given on the Bond

[MK] case called at 3:00pm. 
Defendant Karen K Mueller not in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Adjourned Initial Appearance today. 
The Court notes that Ms. Mueller has filed a Petition for the appointment of counsel, and the Court granted the Petition.  The Court has appointed Attorney Luchsinger as counsel, and because the Court later learned that Attorney Luchsinger is not available to appear today.  
The Court finds that it has jurisdiction over Ms. Mueller and that Ms. Mueller had notice of today's hearing.
The clerk indicates to the Court that she believes that she saw Ms. Mueller earlier, near the 2:00pm scheduled hearing time, at which point the Court was in a closed-session hearing.
The Court orders issuance of a Probable Cause Warrant-- to include a provision that Ms. Mueller may post $500 cash bond in lieu of arrest [a new court date is to be given on the Bond]. 
recess 3:05pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[MK] case called at 2:41pm. 
Defendant Karen K Mueller in court.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

The Court discloses that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that then-DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Ms. Mueller. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, the charge and maximum penalties are recited, the reading of the factual portion of the Criminal Complaint is waived.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Ms. Mueller verifies that she heard the Court provide information on right to counsel, and that constructive waiver of counsel warnings were given
After Ms. Mueller indicates that she intends to seek counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $500 Ssignature bond, with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--to take all prescribed medications as prescribed
--no possession of drug paraphernalia
--not to operate a motor vehicle at all during the time this case pends 
recess 2:51pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appeararnce on 9/22/15 at 2:00pm.
